Back to the lab to get some answers.
11312.content:
Feeling guilty about the entire set of circumstances, you quietly take Jillian’s body out to the parking lot and get into her car. You fasten your safety belt and glance into the mirror. Seeing her reflection was bittersweet…you’d wronged her…jumped into her body and controlled her just to save yourself, and that was wrong…no two ways about it. On the other hand, she was, in some sense, with you, and you could not stand the idea of being without her. A single tear runs down you cheek as you turn the car on and head out of the parking lot. You’re not entirely sure where you’re going to go, but you need to get Jillian out of this mess…wasn’t right to involve her in something like this. It wasn’t safe.

You quickly jump onto the highway and head out of town…not far, but far enough. The buildings slowly fade into the distance, and the roads and gravel are replaced by corn and soybeans. A few other cars dot the road as the sun begins to hang low in the sky. Seeing your destination, you get into the right lane and exit, as the heart beating in Jillian’s chest fills with sadness over what you have to do. You pull into a gas station; the parking lot has only a couple cars in it, and a couple more are at the pumps filling up. Parking the car, you step out and look over by the side of the road at a lone structure. It isn’t much, really, just a thin metal frame with some plexi-glass walls just to shield inhabitants from the wind. Seeing one figure inside the structure, you set off in the direction. Buses came through here every few hours, and one ought to be on the way just about now.

You walk up to the tiny bust stop, Jillian’s heals kicking up a bit of gravel in the process. The person sitting on the bench looks up. She’s got red hair. She appears to be about forty years old with a figure beginning to show its age. It’s not that she was fat, but nor was she thin—she had a full body, complete with an impressive set of cleavage and a little pouch in her belly. This is to say nothing of the nice wide set of hips and wonderful backside upon which she sat. The woman had make-up on, but it was smeared about her face as though she had been crying. Giving a slight sniffle, the woman smiled slightly to acknowledge your presence. She stuck out her hand to shake yours, “I’m Rachel,” she said pleasantly. “Jillian; my friends call me Jill,” you answered. “Good to meet you Jill; what brings you here?”

Taking a seat next to Rachel, you paused. “Well,” I sort of hurt the person I care most about in the whole world…didn’t mean to…but….but that’s what I did,” you began, getting teary-eyed, “and it’s probably not safe for me to be here, so I’ve got to be by myself, hence the bus stop,” you answered. Rachel smiled a little. “I have sort of the opposite problem,” she sniffles, “my boyfriend…with a beautiful 25-year-old body and a 12-year-old brain, threw me out of his bed this morning and told me I reminded him of his mother…said I was sick for ever caring about him…that I was good for sex and nothing else.” “That’s a low blow,” you said to comfort her. “Yup…yes it is. I should have known the age difference would end us…just didn’t plan on ending up 43 and loveless, you know?” The two of you sat in silence for a couple minutes.

“Got any family?” you asked. “No,” she answered glumly, “you?” “Yeah…but I’m a danger to them…to her…and I have to be invisible for her to be safe.” Rachel put her arm around you in a little show of support.

“Well the bus will be here soon; last call to use the facilities,” you said, setting your plan in motion. “Indeed,” Rachel answered, getting up and heading to the gas station with you. On the way in, you asked the guy at the desk for a pen and a piece of paper, which you received. Heading over to a table near the window, you sat down and scribbled a note:

“My Dearest Love,
“I’m sorry about what I did to you. I didn’t mean to….really. This whole thing’s a mess. I love you more than I can say, and that’s why I have to disappear…to protect you. I’m not really going away, but you can’t know where I am, so I think this is for the best. I’ll be around to keep you safe, but please don’t look for me.
Be safe,
Mark”

With the letter written, you stepped into the restroom to find Rachel standing at the mirror as tears began to form in your own eyes. Handing her the letter, you said “Um…do…do you think this is..you know…a good letter?” Rachel took it and read it. She too got teary-eyed as she read.

You slowly walked around behind Rachel. As she finished, she said, “Yeah…yeah that’s really nice, but who’s Mark?” Choking back tears yourself, you quietly said, “For now, he’s you.” With that, you wrapped your arms around Rachel’s voluptuous body and willed her into yourself. She kicked and struggled at first, but this became more futile as she merged more and more with you, her body consumed by the blue, viscous goo that constituted your form. Finally, the last of her disappeared inside you. You steadied Jillian’s weakened body against the bathroom sink as you looked at her reflection in the mirror. After what must have been thirty seconds or so, you felt something familiar.

Jill’s form began to crawl…and bubble. It was as though a million little beetles were crawling around inside her. You watched as her hair turned red. Glancing down, you saw her legs, belly, and chest plump up into the fuller, voluptuous features of the woman you’d just absorbed. After a transformation that lasted roughly a minute, Jill was gone. Now wearing Rachel’s body, you slowly bent down and picked up the letter, leaving the gas station.

Once out a good distance from the building, you stepped behind a large tree and began to will Jill out of yourself. Grunting, moaning and bracing Rachel’s body, you felt the liquid moving around in your stomach, which had seemed to expand…almost as if you were pregnant. Your mouth opened to an absurd degree, and Jill’s head popped out. After a few more seconds, the rest of her emerged, unconscious but unharmed. Breathing heavily, you carried her over and set her down gently on the ground. You placed your letter in her pocket and, tears in your eyes, kissed her passionately on the lips.

You then hitchhiked your way back into town, happy Jillian was safe but heartbroken she was not with you.
11312.title: Try to free Jillian

choices: Implicate Darcy by falsifying the test results
1132.content:
You came to Protean Industries for a reason, and you will be damned if you don’t finish what you started. You take a moment to dry your eyes and fix your make up – you don’t want to draw any more attention if possible. Then you walk out the rest rooms, submerging yourself inside the Jillian personality you hold within yourself, matching your gait to hers.

The lab you share with Jillian, number seventeen, is directly opposite the restrooms on this floor. Steeling yourself, you walk back inside and try to figure out where to pick up Jillian’s investigations. The test results are spread messily over a workbench to one side of the room. Jillian had looked through most of them already, without much success.

You sift your mind through Jillian’s mind, trying to work out where she would have gone next. She still wanted to examine a couple of the tests more closely, but her next major avenue of exploration would have been Darcy herself. The real Darcy, to check for any adverse effects as a result of her absorption.

That’s a course that isn’t without risks of its own: who knows how much Darcy might remember from her time inside you. You trust Jillian’s insight, however. Releasing Darcy again is the next logical step.

You concentrate on the sick to the stomach feeling that you had before you ejected Darcy earlier. You feel your insides rumble and quiver. Moments later, the grisly spectacle of you vomiting up Darcy repeats itself. It takes less than a minute but leaves you feeling shaken and drained.

Darcy is unconscious but breathing shallowly, just as she was before. You reach down to take her pulse, suppressing any thoughts about reabsorbing her. It is weak but steady. You place her in the recovery position before returning to the test results.

You figure you can review the last of this morning’s tests whilst waiting for Darcy to wake up. Unfortunately, the last few pieces of paper prove to be dead ends as well. There simply seems to be no way to tell that the person you were this morning was anyone other than Darcy Whitehead. Even the DNA test was an exact match and there was no sign of any toxins or foreign substances in any of the tissue samples collected.

“Ugh,” comes an unsteady voice from the floor.

“Darcy,” you reply, walking over and kneeling down by the prone girl. “Are you ok, you just kind of… Folded.”

“Jillian,” asks the student, sounding surprised. “Where am I, how did I get here?”

“You’re at Protean, don’t you remember,” you improvise. “You were at the house this morning and you felt faint. You came with me this morning because I wanted to test if you were exposed to something in here by accident.”

“I hope not,” comes an assured sounding voice from by the door to the lab. You stand up and spin round to see Levi Rosenstein, the director of research at Protean. “We’d get terrible press if we went around irradiating interns. That was a joke Doctor Harding.”

“My test,” exclaims Darcy. “I’ve missed my History test.”

“Tests can wait,” replies Rosenstein, walking over to Darcy. He leans down and helps her up off the floor. “Your health is much more important.”

“Right,” says Darcy coldly, pulling her hand free of Rosenstein. “Who is this Jillian?”

“You remember Director Rosenstein,” you say with a brittle smile. “He approved your internship.”

“Oh, of course. Sorry”

“No need to apologise young lady,” says Rosenstein with a smile that suggests precisely the opposite. “But I am concerned with your health. I would be upset if something untoward happened to you on my watch. And if you have accidently been exposed to something, I simply must help you resolve the issue.”

There’s something about Rosenstein’s manner that you find off putting, even more so than usual. For all his bonhomie, both you and Jillian profoundly distrust the man. It’s almost like he seems eager for something to have happened to Darcy.

“Thank you for your concern,” however, is what you actually say, wondering what he is looking for.

“Perhaps a full round of tests,” he suggests nonchalantly. “I would be happy to look over them for you.”

“I already carried some out, they were inconclusive,” you explain, trying to dissuade him.

“Really, then perhaps you could forward the results to me,” he says smiling wolfishly.

“I suppose it wouldn’t hurt to try again,” you backtrack. Far better for him to be looking at results from the genuine Darcy than from your SX-3 fuelled imitation. “That is, if Darcy doesn’t mind.”

Then it strikes you: Does Rosenstein know about the SX-3? Perhaps he thinks Darcy has been exposed to it. There’s a far more sinister question lurking under that though: Why is it so important to him?

“If you think so,” says Darcy, interrupting you chain of thoughts, sounding uncharacteristically unsure of herself.

“It can’t hurt,” you say. “Maybe we missed something earlier.

“Splendid,” says Rosenstein cheerfully, walking towards the door. “I shall expect a copy of the results on my desk tomorrow morning. Farewell for now ladies.”

“What a creep,” shivers Darcy once Rosenstein is out of earshot.

“No arguments from me,” you reply. “Lets get those tests done, if only to keep him off our backs.”

“I… Uh…” Darcy hesitates for a moment. “I’m scared Jillian. I don’t remember anything from this morning. Rosenstein seemed too keen.”

A terrible thought filters into your mind. You’re not sure if it is your own or something from the Jillian persona you are channelling, and you feel a little bit guilty for not discarding it immediately: What if you set up Darcy as a diversion? Falsify the test results to make it look as if she had been exposed to SX-3? That would distract attention from yourself long enough to complete your own research.

You can hardly believe you are even thinking of doing that though. It would be monstrous, and a betrayal of the trust that Darcy has shown in both you and Jillian. You really should protect her from the fallout of yesterdays spillage.
1132.title: Darcy's Return

13.content:
“I have those papers you wanted,” you say, channelling Darcy’s directness, almost instinctively.

There was no choice, you realise. Memories of the David Johnson business come flooding back: The military convoys screaming about Saratoga Falls. The paranoia and mistrust at Fort Suffolk. The stress suffered by Johnson’s family. It was not pleasant, and you have no desire to repeat the experience again. And certainly not as the focus of the military’s attention.

You’re afraid.

And that leaves you with no choice but to impersonate Darcy. No one, not even your own girlfriend, can know about what’s happened to you. At least, not until you know where they stand.

“Ok,” says Jill slowly. “And Mark?”

“The door was open,” you improvise. “I’m sorry Jill, but I’m really in a rush this morning.”

“A rush,” repeats Jill unsurely. Between the earliness of the hour and Darcy’s brisk nature, you’ve wrong footed her.

“I’ve got this European history test at 8,” you continue, getting into the flow of things. It’s surprising how easy it is to mimic Darcy, and how easy it is to animate her personality and make it do what you want. “I’ve been up all night studying and all I want to do is take the test and then find somewhere to sleep.”

“Oh sure,” says Jill smiling fuzzily. “I guess I better let you get to it then. I’ll see you, what, this afternoon? Or tomorrow?”

“Probably tomorrow,” you say, turning to leave. “Bye Jill.”

“Yeah, bye,” she replies absent mindedly as you walk away. Closing the door behind you, you can see Jill looking around the house. “Mark? Mark, where are you?”

You feel a pang of guilt, but then, the alternatives would be so much worse.

*****


You put your pen down on the desk and look at your, no Darcy’s, watch. It’s an elegant silver bracelet, somehow and miraculously reproduced by the SX-3 in your body. It shows twenty five minutes past ten, the same time as the clock on the wall at the far end of the hall. That it seems to work poses some interesting questions about the SX-3 – how it was able to form a working mechanical system from your body.

It is a question more relevant than the one you have just answered, a two and a half hour essay on the Thirty Years War. The Darcy persona you’ve submerged yourself in since this morning is tired, but relieved to have finished. For you, it has been two and a half wasted hours. You push the Darcy thoughts to one side and start to think on your own problems as the test papers are collected in.

Protean would be an obvious place to start, you think as you begin packing up your equipment. As Darcy, you would have access. It would be a limited access as she is only an intern, but an access of a sort. At least she would normally. By now Jill must have realised that you are missing. If she’s told anyone then things might be difficult, doubly so if she has mentioned the incident with the SX-3 yesterday. Laying low for a few days to see how things pan out might be wiser in that case.

Your train of thought is interrupted as you leave the hall by someone shouting Darcy’s name. You turn your head and see another girl waving at you. She’s Asian, short (but then so are you now) and quite pretty in an alternative sort of way. Her shiny black hair is layered with bright neon pink stripes, tied up in high bunches at the side of her heads. A tight fitting tee and jeans show off her gentle curves.

Of course, you have no idea who she is.

You reach again for Darcy’s mind, slipping again into her memories. A name floats to the surface: Summer. A friend, simply because she’s the only other ex-Eastman High School student in this class.

“Heya Darcy, how’d you do,” she asks, smiling brightly as she bounds over to you.

A little stray Darcy thought slips through your mind: amazement at how much Summer’s personality has changed over the last year since she hooked up with that Yves girl. You file it away for future reference before returning her smile.

“Good,” you reply. “I did spend all night studying after all, so I should do well.”

“Wow,” she says. “Keen. You must be tired.”

“A little,” you acknowledge as you open the door for Summer. “I was going to go home and get some sleep.”

“Coffee,” asks Summer, apparently ignoring you.

“No, I’m too tired,” you begin, before clutching your stomach. An intense, stabbing pain grips you and you double over.

“Are you ok,” asks Summer.

“I think I’m going to throw up,” you reply before bolting into a nearby toilet. You have just enough time to push your way into an empty stall and close the door behind you before the pain returns. Your stomach turns somersaults as you kneel over the bowl and you feel something rush up from inside you.

Then it gets really weird.

Your jaw opens wide to accommodate the sheer volume of vomit, distending far beyond what should be natural. The fluid is warm and sweet. Viscous, it seems to start solidifying as it leaves your mouth. The flow stops for a moment, giving you a chance to realise what’s happening.

Jutting out from your impossibly wide mouth is another Darcy. Or her head at least, possibly even the real Darcy.

Sweating profusely, you raise a hand to just in front of your face. It as if you are melting, the fingers of your hand fusing together like a glob of molten wax. Slowly the colour fades from your skin and it takes on a bright blue hue, matching the tone of the SX-3.

You have no time to think on this as another swirl of liquid starts to move around inside your stomach. It swells and grows and, just as you think the pressure will make you burst open, well…

That’s when you burst open.

Splitting vertically right down the middle, your torso opens and Darcy comes tumbling out. She lies on the floor, curled round the toilet. Her breathing seems shallow and she is unconscious. Otherwise, she appears unchanged from when you met her earlier this morning. You rise unsteadily to your feet, by this point little more than shapeless blue mass with only the vaguest approximation of human form. Then something snaps within you and your form returns.

You are you again.

Albeit a you in your dressing gown. Stuck inside the ladies toilets. With a young lady lying unconscious on the floor in front of you. It couldn’t be much worse, you think.

“Darcy, are you ok in there,” comes a voice from outside the stall. Summer has followed you in.

Ok, so it could get worse. It can always get worse. You have no idea how you absorbed Darcy earlier, but it looks like the only way to get out of here is to repeat the process again. Unless you want to try to absorb Summer.
13.title: Just go to Darcy's classes

131.content:
“Darcy,” yells Summer, thumping on the stall door. “Darcy, open up.”

Not good. Not good at all. Unless you do something Summer is likely to try to open the door herself in a minute. You still have no idea what caused you to absorb Darcy within yourself this morning, but right now your best chance is somehow trigger it again. You kneel back down on the floor beside her slumbering body. Wrapping your arms around her, you try to will the change to take place.

Nothing happens.

“Should I come in,” asks Summer, knocking on the stall door again.

It’s not working. Desperately, you think back to what happened this morning: Darcy arriving at the door. Darcy getting the papers out her bag. Darcy giving you the papers. No. That’s not right, she dropped the papers as you reached to take them. That’s when it happened, when you tried to take something from her.

So you start thinking about what you want to take. Her body, her memories, her very identity. You feel it as your flesh begins to lose its solidity, engulfing Darcy and drawing her within yourself. The changes come on quickly after that. Bones grind and pop as they shift themselves into new shapes. Flesh bubbles and swells, padding out some areas and thinning in others. You groan involuntarily in a low, masculine, register which rapidly rises in pitch.

“I’m coming in,” shouts Summer from the other side of the stall door.

She starts pushing at the door, trying to get in. You doubt it will hold long and starting willing the transformation to go faster, praying it will finish before Summer makes it in.

“Ow,” you screech as the lock breaks and the door snaps open and hits you squarely on the ass.

“Oh sorry,” says Summer as she helps you to your feet. She doesn’t seem to have noticed anything out of the ordinary so you guess you managed to luck out and finish becoming Darcy in time. “So are you ok?”

“I’m fine,” you snap, carefully modulating your tone to match the way the real Darcy would reply. “It was just a stomach upset. Something I ate.”

“Sorry, sorry,” says Summer a little insouciantly as she hooks her arm into yours and leads you away from the stall. “You sounded a little weird there for a moment, like a guy or something”.

You pause for a moment and turn to face Summer. You give her a cool stare for a moment.

“I said sorry,” she says, acting hurt. “So how about that coffee then?”

“No,” you reply firmly. “I should get some sleep.”

Summer looks at you uncertainly for a moment, then with a cheery wave she bids you goodbye. She walks out the door, leaving you alone in the toilets. You inspect yourself carefully in the mirror, turning your head first one way then the other, making sure that the transformation is complete. There is neither any hint of your real self, nor that you are anyone other than who you appear to be.

Darcy had planned to go home and get some sleep after her test, and sifting through her feelings you can sense just how tired she would be by now. It’s tempting to give in to her tiredness, submerged as you are in her persona. On the other hand, you, the core of yourself buried deep under the fake Darcy self, aren’t tired at all. What you really need to do is start researching your condition – work out what the SX-3 has done to you. It wouldn’t hurt to check up on how Jillian is reacting to your apparent disappearance either. Both of these things would lead you back to Protean Industries. Since Darcy is an intern there, you can walk straight in too. With your mind made up, you spend a brief moment primping your hair before setting out.

*****


Protean is quite close to Keyserling, located on a modern research and business park not far from the college grounds, so it doesn’t take long to get there. You were able to walk in past security with no problems. There were no extra guards, no worried looking faces and no sign at all that anybody is concerned over the sudden disappearance of Mark Taylor.

Your lab looks almost exactly as you left it yesterday. There’s no sign that anyone else has been in here, aside from Jillian. She’s leaning over one of the benches opposite the door, rummaging through a messy pile of computer print outs. Jillian appears a little haggard looking, not quite herself. You can’t quite make out what the problem is from this distance.

“Jillian,” you call out. “Dr Harding.”

Jillian looks up from her papers and gives you a forlorn little wave before resuming her deliberations. Not wanting to disturb her any more than necessary, you start to walk across the lab to her position. The clacking of your shoes on the hard surface of the floor rings loudly in the otherwise silent lab. As you approach, you get a clearer look at Jillian. She hasn’t styled her hair with her usual care and attention, instead tying it up into a very rough ponytail. Her make up is a little smudged, suggesting she’s been crying.

“Is everything alright,” you ask abruptly. It’s a typically direct Darcy question.

“Yes, yes, everything’s fine,” Jillian replies, looking in almost every direction except directly at you.

“You seem out of sorts,” you state. Darcy isn’t the most sensitive people but even she would have noticed just how upset Jillian is. She just wouldn’t be very tactful about it. “Where’s Mark?”

Jillian pauses for a moment. She snuffles a little before answering. “He’s back at home. He’s come down with the flu.”

You feel a bit guilty for asking. Jillian’s obviously upset, and your questions have upset her further. However, you’ve learned something important – that she’s kept the promise she made yesterday not to tell anyone. That’s something that makes you think she deserves a little of your trust in return.

“Jillian, Jill,” you say hesitantly, letting the mask of Darcy’s thoughts slip from your mind. “I know where Mark is.”

“I told you,” she says shakily, not looking up from her papers. “He’s at home”

“He’s not,” you say softly. “Jill, look up. Look up and listen.”

She drops her paper to the desk and looks directly at you, misery etched on her face.

“You have to trust me,” you continue. “Promise me you can stay calm for the next five minutes.”

“You’re not making any sense Darcy,” says Jillian flatly.

“Please,” you plead. “Just… Just say you’ll stay calm. Just for five minutes.”

“I guess I can,” she says unsurely. “You’re still not making any sense though.”

“Just… Just watch.”

You stand still for a minute, trying to recall the feeling in your stomach from earlier. A stabbing pain tells you that you have succeeded, and soon enough you feel the fluid starting to gush up your throat. Even though you know what to expect this time, the process of releasing Darcy from within you is just as weird and sickening as before. Hunched on the floor, sweating at the effort of it, you are unable to gauge Jillian’s reaction to what she is seeing other than from an occasional shocked gasp.

And then it is over. Darcy lies unconscious on the floor as you stand back up, your blue waxy flesh solidifying back into your real from. You look Jillian in the eye, unable to read the expression on her face.
131.title: Darcy, Darcy...

1313.content:
Whatever Jillian’s reaction is, it gets lost in the chaos that follows.

The door to the lab bursts open and three security guards rush in and take position about a metre and a half away from you. Each holds some kind of weapon in their hands, pointed directly at you. Not a gun, tasers of some kind.

“On the floor,” one of them shouts at you. The other two pick up the refrain and repeat it. “Get on the fucking floor”

You look at the men. They’re all heavy set, strong looking ex-military or ex-police types. That’s the kind of people Protean hires for security. You doubt you could take one, let alone all three.

“On the floor Taylor,” the shouting continues, three voices not quite in synch. “Get on the floor Taylor.”

You look around you, confused and unable to believe this is happening. Jillian is shocked, unable to move. The security guards are watching you warily, expressions of determination on their faces.

Wait, not all of them.

The third guard is different. Not cut from the same mould as the other two, a little more overweight, a little less sure of himself. You watch as a bead of sweat runs down the side of his face, as his fingers tighten uncertainly on the trigger of his taser.

Then he shoots you.

A moments nervousness on his part and he accidently pulled the trigger. You feel the electric shock riding through your body but you somehow cling onto consciousness. You look down at the darts sticking into your chest. Where they’ve hit, and for all the area around them, your flesh has become the waxy bright blue of SX-3.

You look back up. The guard is staring at you in amazement, still holding onto his taser. On a whim, you grab the cables and tug. They dig into the palms of your hands which turn the same waxy blue as your chest as the cables sink in. Maybe it’s broken somehow, or maybe it’s just stupid design, but the taser is pulled with them. The guard, still dazed, stumbles forward with the gun until you reach out and grab him.

He is stronger than you and he does struggle. It makes no difference, all that happens is he gets himself more and more entangled in your melting flesh. You draw him in with a sickening slurp. The shouting all around you changes tone.

“Jesus Christ.”

“What the fuck?”

“The hell…”

The remaining security guards professionally manage to hold their tasers level at you, but you can see the bewilderment on their faces as your form starts to shift into that of the guard you hav just absorbed.

A fourth guard enters by the broken lab door. He is tall and broad shouldered, powerfully built. Greying hair is cropped close in a buzz cut. A livid red scar curves up his neck, instantly identifying him as Chip Henklemann, the chief of Security at Protean.

“Take him down gentlemen,” he rasps, staring coldly at you. “Use everything you’ve got.”

The room starts to spin as you take another shock, and then another. By the time Henklemann closes to take his shot, you are having difficulty keeping your eyes open. Your vision starts to blur and everything turns mercifully black.

*****


“Wake up Mr Taylor”

You blink a couple of times and try to survey your surroundings.

“Wake up Mr Taylor,” comes the voice again. It is rich and smooth, full of confidence.

You are Lenny Davidson, retired cop and security guard. No, that’s not right. Slowly your memories come back into focus. You remember what happened in the lab, from your perspective and Lenny’s. You drag yourself upright and take a look around.

You are in a small room. Very small, barely five metres across and the only furnishing is the hard bed you were just lying on. One wall is entirely made of glass, through which you can see another, larger room. It looks like another Protean lab, although the lighting is much lower than the one you share with Jillian. A door is set in one wall of your room but there is seemingly no way of opening it, at least from this side.

“Good Mr Taylor,” says the voice. You recognise Protean’s head of research, Levi Rosenstein, standing on the other side of the glass wall. “Or should that be Mr Davidson.”

You stare blankly at the man, still getting your bearings.

“Just who am I talking to,” continues Rosenstein, a little more insistently this time.

“Mark,” you eventually admit.

“That would make sense,” replies Rosenstein, smiling a little smugly. “I have to admit, I didn’t expect this kind of reaction from SX-3, not after reading the Johnson reports.”

He stands silently for a few seconds.

“You were exposed to SX-3 Mr Taylor,” he continues. “I am correct in that assumption, yes?”

“Yes,” you mumble. No point hiding it now, you don’t know how long they have been watching Jillian’s lab.

“And that bring us to, shall we say, the heart of the matter. This lab you are in, built to permit the study of an individual exposed to SX series chemicals. All planed out for some time now, and then along you come before I am able to arrange exposure myself.”

You stare mutely at Rosenstein, you can think of nothing to say.

“You are inconvenient Mr Taylor, but also an opportunity. You’ve survived the exposure to SX-3 and apparently with unusual powers,” Rosenstein stops for a moment, his eyes narrow behind his trendy glasses. “You are a subject of interest for Protean industries, so I’m going to offer you a choice.”

Silence settles over the lab as Rosenstein stops talking. From your previous encounters with the man, you know he can be fond of theatricality.

“You can cooperate with us. Let us run the experiments that we’d like to. You and Doctor Harding will be well compensated.”

“And if I don’t want to co-operate,” you ask, dreading the answer.

“Well, we’ll have to carry out the experiments anyway, but forcing your compliance will be time consuming and unproductive. We might be required to find an alternative test subject. The good doctor perhaps? Of course, we can’t guarantee that an alternative test subject would survive the exposure as you have.”

Rosenstein lets the threat hang in the air for a moment.

“But you will cooperate Mr Taylor, will you not?”

“You monster,” you say venomously. “This would never have happened at Fort Suffolk.”

“The army, Mr Taylor, does not have a board of directors to answer to,” replies Rosenstein impatiently. “You will find that they are considerably less forgiving than a senate committee or the joint chiefs. Now I am waiting for an answer Mr Taylor.”
1313.title: A shocking development

13131.content:
"So, Mr. Taylor, are you ready to start today?"

Dr. Rosenstein looks at you with a bit of a leer. You've realized, over the last two weeks or so after you agreed to cooperate with Rosenstein for his tests, that he is a very unsettling individual. His single-minded, results at all costs mindset leaves him about as warm as a glacier and with seemingly no care for the well being of those involved with his tests. It's left those who work with him, security, other scientists, executives and such to occasionally refer to him as Mengele; and the irony of referring to a man with a Jewish name as that isn't lost on them. In fact, Rosenstein is aware of it and seems to not be bothered, which makes him all the more unsettling.

"Ah, yeah. Sure thing Doc." you say in a Texan drawl.

"Good, good. First thing's first Mr. Taylor, I would like to see how much, if any, of your previous... meals your form remembers." states Rosenstein in a matter-of-fact manner. "If you would, please try to change into each and every person you've absorbed."

You nod and with that your form begins changing, spending about thirty seconds as each person: Darcy Whitehead, college student and intern. Lenny Davidson, ex-cop and security officer for Protean. From there it was seeing how long you could hold a person for. For one day you were Kathryn Donaldson, Rosenstein's assistant. For two days you were Susanna Huffman, the newest secretary at Protean. You spent three days as accountant Thom Allan and then, on Rosenstein's orders, a day each as Thom's family: Thom's wife Karin, 12-year-old daughter Bailey, and 9-year-old daughter Lindsay.

You then change back into who you've spent the last four days as: Drew Williams, a contractor for TRS Solutions, a PMC currently based out of Fort Suffolk. It wasn't hard, the base and Protean have close ties and TRS contractors tend to be used as security.

"Alright, excellent." says Rosenstein, "Now then, if you would eject Ms. Williams."

You nod and think about ejecting her from your form. However nothing happens. You try again and still nothing. A third time, yet like the previous two times nothing happens.

"Mr. Taylor?" asks Rosenstein.

"I dunno, Doc. I've been tryin' ta get 'er outta me but I'm gettin' nothin'." you state in a perplexed manner.

Rosenstein nods, "And her memories?"

"Her memories an' personality an' stuff, I got all'a that." you state. You then change shape back into Bailey Allan. "But if I'm like this? Nothing about her mind is there. Same with anyone else I turn into. Unless they're part of me I don't have access to their mind."

"Interesting, quite interesting indeed." Rosenstein nods.

You tuck a bit of brown hair behind your ear, "What's so interesting?" you ask.

"I'd like you to change back into yourself." states Rosenstein. He notices you give him a look, "Please, Mr. Taylor, just give it a try."

You nod and try to change back into yourself, into Mark Taylor. Much like when you tried to release Drew, however, nothing happens. A few more attempts but once more nothing. "What the fuck?!" you exclaim and it's very odd coming out of your current form, "What's going on?!"

"Mr. Taylor, please calm down." says Rosenstein. "I'd like you to clear your mind. We've done this before, by focusing on just letting go of your form you're able to naturally shift back to your default shape. So give that a try, please."

You nod and do as Rosenstein says. It works... in a way. You're surprised, however, when you shift not into Mark Taylor but Drew Williams.

"What the shit?" you ask in Drew's thick Texan accent. "Why can't I turn back into myself?"

"Because I suspect that is yourself now." Rosenstein says as he adjusts his glasses. "My own research combined with Dr. Harding's and your cooperation has given me a theory, if you would like to hear it." He waits until you nod, "When you absorb someone, you're slowly digesting them into yourself. Any time between the absorption and digestion you're able to divest yourself of that person. However after a period they are completely digested and thus become a permanent part of you. It would seem that period is four days."

"Alright, that makes sense I guess. But that still doesn't explain why I'm stuck as Williams." you say, the annoyed tone obvious in your voice.

"Well to continue my theory," says Rosenstein, "What I suspect is that actually have no human form. Your appearance itself was nothing more than genetic leftovers. I suspect that when you digested Ms. Williams what was left was converted to her own. Thus you are now, by default, Drew William."

"But then how come I still think I'm Mark Taylor?" you ask.

Rosenstein's expression becomes more perplexed at that. "That I am not sure of. Perhaps because your thoughts, your personality, what makes you you mentally is not genetic. Something needs to control your physical body. That's just a theory, of course."

"And what about if I digest someone else?" you ask. "Would I still be able to become Williams?"

"Possibly. As I said, 'Mark Taylor' was just some leftover genetic code. Like scraping off dead skin flakes. Drew Williams is part of you now. If you digested someone else they would probably become your default form but I have reason to believe that you will not be able to rid yourself of Ms. Williams in that manner." You grumble at that and Rosenstein seems to show a rare moment of compassion. "We've learned a lot in the short time you've been here today. Take the day off."

* * * * *

You stand in your bathroom, looking at the body that's replaced your own. Drew Williams is very much a butch type of woman and yet see that there's still a rough prettiness under that exterior. Light blue eyes, a narrow nose, full lips, bleached hair that was in a buzz cut but has since grown out just a tiny bit. Your body, clad in dark athletic pants and a sports bra, is lean yet muscular with rock hard abs and an A-cup chest. Being the peak physical health is something Drew takes a large amount of pride in.

There's a half-sleeve tattoo on your left arm done in a tribal style. On the inside of your right forearm is a simple group of tallymarks that represent the number of confirmed kills she had when she was still with the army. She spent her last couple of tours in Iraq and Afghanistan as a sniper. She'd been a crack shot since the first time her dad had given her a gun. Her dad was ex-military himself, having served in Vietnam, as was her grandfather who was a veteran of both World War II and the Korean War. All of that, combined with growing up adjacent to Fort Hood in Killeen, Texas, caused Drew to grow up with a healthy respect for the military; she eagerly joined the Army out of high school and once combat positions were opened up to women she eagerly transferred over and excelled.

Now 33-years-old, her military career came to an end when she caught the attention of TRS Solutions and was given a discharge to join up with them.

"So how are you doing?" Jillian's voice comes from the bathroom doorway.

You turn to look at her. "Fuck, I dunno Jillian. This shit... so much's happened in the last few days and none of it's makin' any sense." you sigh, "An' I'm worried that me bein' like this is gonna fuck up our relationship."

"Oh don't be so silly." she smiles, "I fell in love with who you were inside, not who you were physically. We'll make it work. Besides you can still be a guy right?"

"Yeah, well, inside I'm me and this chick and a middle-aged accountant and a 12-year-old girl." you state glumly, "But yeah, I dunno. This girl goes both ways anyway so we could always..."

You smile as you grab Jillian by the hand and she giggles as you drag her in. You have no clue if she'd go for it but you're about to test that "not in love with who you are physically" thing. Or you were until you hear your cellphone go off in the living room. You roll your eyes and head out to grab it.

A few minutes later you hang up and Jillian joins you out in the living room. "Who was that?" she asks.

"Rosenstein." you state, "Turns out that he's been keepin' Protean's investors informed of what's been goin' on with me an' the SX-3 and they're mighty interested in it."

"Interested how?" asks Jillian.

"This company, Rosenstein said their name was Fane or some shit like that, has ties with Fort Suffolk but they feel that Col. Lord, the guy runnin' things there, ain't bein' on the up and up with 'em." you explain, "So they want me to infiltrate it. Get close to Lord, keep an eye on him, report to Fane what he's doin'."

"Well this woman, she works for that PMC based out of the base right?"

You nod, "Yeah but she ain't gonna be good enough. I'd have to get close to Lord. Someone he trusts. One of his right hands."

"That'd be Sanchez, then, right?" asks Jillian, "Or..."

She trails off and you know why. The other person is Claire Briggs, Jillian's close friend. Claire and Eric Sanchez are both Lord's number two at the base.

"Well they gave me a choice. Either I do that or I head to England, Cambridge I think Rosenstein said, to meet with some Fane guys personally." you state.

"That would... that would put us apart for god knows how long." says Jillian.

You nod once more, "Yeah, an' they said it'd have to be me solo. But if I wint I would have a way of takin' you..." Jillian looks at you, you give a small smile as realization sets in on her face. "I absorb ya, fly over to England, eject ya in a hotel room. Me an' you, we can scope out these Fane guys together."

“Darcy,” yells Summer, thumping on the stall door. “Darcy, open up.”

Not good. Not good at all. Unless you do something Summer is likely to try to open the door herself in a minute. You still have no idea what caused you to absorb Darcy within yourself this morning, or if you can even do it again. Maybe you only get one shot at absorbing a person. Maybe you can’t ever absorb another person at all. Either way, Summer is a more pressing problem than the unconscious Darcy. Absorb her, knock her out, whatever, it doesn’t matter just so long as you can get the hell out of here.

“I’m coming out,” you try to say in falsetto. Not the most convincing idea you’ve had, but the strange thing is it works - it doesn’t just sound higher than your normal voice, it sounds exactly like Darcy. You consider the possibility that the SX-3 has left you with some residual memory of being Darcy but decide to think more on it later.

You hear Summer take a step back away from the door. It’s do or die time. You fumble with the stall lock before opening the door as suddenly as you can. Although Summer is looking directly at you she is simply too stunned at your unexpected appearance to do anything other than stare blankly at you with her mouth open. That gives you ample time to take the two steps over to her and place your right hand firmly over her mouth. You push the increasingly frightened looking young woman back against the row of sinks on the far wall, pinning her in place.

“Mmmpf,” she tries to say, her voice muffled.

Roughly, you spin her round with your free arm, looping it round her chest and holding her in tight against her yourself. Staring at your reflection in the large mirror that runs along the wall above the sinks you will the change to happen. Below your own reflected image you can see Summer’s eyes start to dart wildly from side to side. She’s struggling, trying desperately to break out of your grip. You were never particularly strong, but Summer is at least a foot shorter than you and quite thin. It’s easy enough to hold her in place. Again you will the change to begin.

Nothing happens.

It’s not working. Panicking, you think back to what happened this morning: Darcy arriving at the door. Darcy getting the papers out her bag. Darcy giving you the papers. No. That’s not right, she dropped the papers as you reached to take them. That’s when it happened, when you tried to take something from her.

It seems like a long shot, but what other option do you have. You start thinking about what you want to take: Her body, her memories, her very identity. Just as Summer is trying to stamp the heel of her boot onto your foot, you feel your flesh starting to flow. The boot sinks painlessly into your foot with a squelch. Summer’s eyes go wide for a moment as she spots the fingers of your right hand, the one held over her mouth, starting to fuse together. Then she goes limp. You watch, horrified, as she is drawn within your body, your melting flesh lapping round her, pulling her in. She sinks within you, leaving a misshapen mess – still recognisably Mark Taylor but weirdly distorted and with unsightly bumps and protrusions all over your body.

You burp loudly.

Then the changes start to happen. Bones grind and pop as they shift themselves into new shapes. Flesh bubbles and swells, padding out some areas and thinning in others. You watch as your hair starts to lengthen, turning a shiny black in places and hot pink in others. Amazingly, it lifts itself up of its own accord and ties itself into the bunches Summer was wearing. While you can barely feel the changes that write themselves across your face, at least in comparison to the ones on the rest of your body, they are fascinating to watch in the mirror. It is as if your skin crawls, stretching itself into a new shape, pulling at your eyes to give them an exotic looking slant, squeezing your nose into a small delicate shape.

Then you are Summer Nguyen, 19 years old and a student at Keyserling College. Struggling to make ends meet because you are estranged from your father. Tired out from the stress of studying and working part time, but ultimately happy because your life is your own. At least it was until five minutes ago. Hidden inside this shell is your real self, beyond the detection of the military and Protean Industries. You cannot help but smile. Just the way Summer would.

You’ll have time to investigate your new identity more thoroughly later you think as you pick up Summer’s satchel from where she dropped it. There’s one last detail to attend to – Darcy. She’s still lying prone in the stall. Finding out what she remembers of this morning would be useful, so you give her a gentle shake until she starts to stir.

“Where… Where am I,” Darcy asks slowly as you help her to her feet. “Summer? What’s going on?”

“Are you ok,” you ask, perfectly mimicking the kind of concern Summer would show in the situation. “I think you fainted or something.”

“Where am I” ask Darcy again, this time a little more insistently as she regains her composure.

“Uh, the toilets,” you respond a little mischievously.

“Obviously,” replies Darcy a little wearily. “And where are the toilets?”

“Penn Hall, at Keyserling. You mean you don’t know how you got here,” you add, feigning ignorance.

“I wouldn’t ask otherwise,” says Darcy, staring meaningfully at you. “The last thing I remember is… Oh god, the test!”

“Already done, and you just told me you thought you did well.”

There is a moment of awkward silence.

“Maybe I’ve been pushing myself to hard,” says Darcy, sounding uncharacteristically unsure of herself.

“Well, you did mention something about being up all night,” you respond, shrugging your shoulders. “You really remember nothing at all until you got here?”

“Nothing. I was at Dr Harding’s, she’s the one helping me out with my biosciences course,” explains Darcy. “And now I’m here. Nothing in between.”

“Maybe it’s stress,” you say, trying to conceal how pleased you are to hear that she doesn’t remember what’s happened to her. “You should get some rest, I’m sure you’ll feel better tomorrow.”

“Yeah,” says Darcy, although she doesn’t sound convinced. “I should go home.”

“I’ll catch you later,” you say with a cheery wave as you walk out the door.

*****


Darcy may be heading to bed, but Summer’s day is just beginning. Living out her life, keeping a low profile, seems like a good idea right now. It will give you a chance to see if there is any major reaction to your disappearance. Since Summer isn’t directly connected to you in the same way Darcy is, it is unlikely that your new identity will attract immediate suspicion from anyone who starts to guess what the SX-3 has done to you.

With that in mind you spend an hour or so pottering about in the campus library. Summer is an arts major. Not exactly your strong suit, but with her mind at your command you easily manage the work she had planned. After that, you make your way over to the coffee house where she works part time, arriving just in time for the start of her shift.

It’s an independent operation, not part of any big chain and just a little bit upmarket. Sitting just on the edge of the Keyserling campus and close to the research park where Protean Industries is located. The clientele is a mix of post-grads, lecturers and workers from the research park. Students tend to keep out unless they work for the place. As the lunchtime trade picks up, you find yourself kept very busy. So busy you don’t notice when someone you, the real you, know comes in until they order their ‘coffee, just coffee, black with none of that junk you seem to insist on putting into it’.

Claire Briggs, Lieutenant Claire Briggs, is a friend of Jillian’s, and her connection back to the military base you both worked at last year. It’s odd for her to be out this way, since Fort Suffolk is on the other side of Saratoga Falls. You watch surreptitiously as she sits herself at an empty table and unfolds a newspaper and starts to read it. She’s clearly waiting for someone.

You get a shock when her guest arrives. Jillian walks in, orders a coffee from one of your co-workers and sits beside Claire. The two immediately fall into a hushed conversation. Despite your best efforts to hang around them, clearing tables and taking orders, you can’t overhear anything more than the odd word from the pair.

You find yourself desperate to know what is being discussed, and frustrated that there seems to be no way to find out. The conversation goes on for some time as the lunchtime rush starts to calm down and the coffee house empties. Yet still, you can’t hear what’s being said. You are on the verge of giving up when Claire excuses herself and makes her way to the toilet.

It worked this morning, why not now? You could follow her and read the conversation from her memories. You could even wait and see if Jillian makes a visit. On the other hand, the coffee house is still busy and you don’t want to risk being seen. It might be better to stick to your plan to lay low as Summer.

You eye the door to the women's restroom for a moment unsure of what to do but eventually you shake it off and head out from behind the counter to go clean a table. You're curious to know what the conversation is between your girlfriend and the lieutenant is but at the same time you're still not quite sure on whether you could absorb Claire or not. Would you be able to? If so would you have to give up Summer? If you had to that might give Claire time to act before you can do anything. Even grabbing her might not be the best idea because as a soldier she's undoubtedly been trained in CQC and she might react in a manner that would put you in danger. That'd be real bad for the whole "laying low" thing.

So you continue to clean, continue to take orders and deliver drinks, continue to make drinks and ring up the register all while trying to eavesdrop. Your efforts are in vain however as after about another 20 minutes Claire and Jillian pay another barista, a girl named Courtney Hamilton, who had been waiting on them most of the lunch hour and leave. You pull her aside and try a desperate, direct approach. "Hey those two... any clue what they were talking about?" you ask her. She gives you a look and you press on, "Well I mean I always see those two with some other guy and now he's not there, you know? Kind of weird."

Courtney just shakes her head. "You're going on like you're still part of Alyssa's group." She replies referring to a group that Summer was part of back in high school. Courtney was another student at Eastman that was part of the same graduating class as Darcy and Summer so of course she knows all about the Rumoratti, although now the only ones still around are Tina and Mandy; the others went off to schools either in other parts of the state or out of state though they keep in touch regularly via Facebook and the like. She gives a smile though, "I really can't believe you were so quiet until close to the end of the year. You're, like, way different now." she adds before heading back behind the counter as you go back to bussing a few more tables.

Courtney is another friend that Summer's made since starting at Keyserling. As you continue Summer's shift you decide to lose yourself in her and her recent memories. Dating Chris Yves had been a good thing for Summer who had previously been very shy and withdrawn with plenty of confidence issues. Chris, however, had showed her that she was a pretty girl who needed to just show people the same confidence she had to other people that she had while the two of them talked. An attraction developed which allowed Summer to come to terms with her sexuality (something she had been struggling with throughout high school) and the two began dating. It wasn't to last, sadly, as Chris went off to school in Maryland. However the relationship had been a nice kick for Summer and by the time she started at Keyserling she had become a much more confident, much more outgoing and well-liked person around campus.

As your break comes you get a call, almost literally as you're walking out the door. "Summer, hey! You on break?" comes a voice on the other end.

"Oh, Rhonda. Um, yeah it just started." you answer. "You're out of class I'm guessing?"

"Ugh, yeah thank god." comes the reply accompanied by a gagging motion, "Professor Winston's such goddamn bore. Oh but hey enough about me, what time are you off at?" asks Rhonda. She takes your reply of 5 PM.happily. "Alright cool. Let's meet up at that Japanese place on 57th when you get off then. It's been a few days since we've been out to eat, you know?"

After an exchange of goodbyes you hang up. Summer has been dating Rhonda Turner, a 20-year-old sophomore, for about the last eight months when they met at a party that one of the sororities was throwing. Rhonda was a bit of a dork into stuff like comic books, video games and anime but she also had a large, outgoing personality and a generally adorable look that made people think of her as something akin to a cute little kitten... albeit a kitten with ear gauges and lip and eyebrow piercings. The two of them got along swimmingly and both being rather petite and cute had earned the nickname (coined by Courtney) of the Diabetes Duo and last month they both broke down, moved out of their respective dorms and got an apartment together. As Rhonda's father was the owner of one of the biggest car dealerships in the area affording rent wasn't a problem after all although Rhonda herself, not wanting to be one of those well-off kids who sponged off of their parents exclusively, did clerical work for her father's dealership.

It was a feeling that made you a little better about not choosing to go after Claire as it reminded you a lot of when you and Jillian had moved in together and were practically inseparable. It was a comforting feeling and on one hand you felt a pang of guilt about not letting Summer herself experience this little date but on the other after the stress you'd been through in the last two days it would be nice to settle into something comforting for at least a short time.

* * * * *



After arriving back home from dinner you had decided to hop into the shower. You clean yourself off and becoming extra familiar with your current form making sure to catch one last appearance of it wet and glistening before drying off and wrapping a towel around you. Summer's still a pretty sight, even with her hair wet you think as you look into the mirror and think back to how you acquired her in the restroom. You remember the weird occurence of your pitch-perfect imitation of Darcy's voice. You've always been terrible at impersonations so you're surprised you were able to pull it off. Curious if you could still do it you clear your throat before speaking. "Hello hello?" you ask nobody, "Testing." You're surprised, and a little delighted, when another perfect copy of Darcy's voice emerges from your mouth. "Whoa, this is kind of neat." you say, wondering if it's a side effect of the SX-3. "Hi, I'm Darcy Whitehead. I need to work on being a little less standoffish." you continue laughing.

And then something happens that surprises you: you begin feeling weird in your face and head and you catch your features bubbling, shifting, re-arranging and molding until quickly Darcy's head is resting on Summer's body. "Eep!" you squeal, this time in Summer's voice, "Wh-wh-what's going on!" you wonder aloud as you touch your Darcy face. What the hell happened? What's going on? So many questions run through your head before your thoughts are interrupted by a knock on the bathroom door and Rhonda's voice calling from the other side.

"Summer? You alright in there?" she asks.

You close your eyes and concentrate on Summer's face and head wishing that you had it. You don't know how Rhonda would react suddenly seeing her girlfriend's head replaced after all. You hear the door open and your eyes shoot open relieved to see Summer's features once again. "I heard you squeal." she says as you look over at her, a mop of sandy, curly hair sitting on top of a cute face that's a mix of white and black features (as Rhonda herself is the product of a black father and white mother), a nice-sized chest and wide hips all in a package that couldn't have been more than 5'2".

"Yeah it's nothing." you say trying to play it off, "It's just this dumb towel started falling off and..."

"Oh is that it?" Rhonda replies, a sly smirk on her face, "Well how about we slip it off and I really make you squeal?"

You allow yourself to slip back down into Summer's personality and giggle as Rhonda drags you off to the bedroom. As the two of you begin kissing you notice a bit of a queasy feeling in your stomach that quickly passes and you don't acknowledge. You're too caught up in passion to really care about something minor like a bit of butterflies in your stomach after all. The thing with Darcy's face was weird but you needed to push it out of your mind as right now there was a girl far more in need of your attention. There's no harm in ignoring it you think...

“Ow” you say, as you trip over your feet and fall heavily on the tiled floor. And then again, just for the extra effect. “Ow.”

Ok, it doesn’t seem like the best plan in the world but you are sure it will work. It would take a heart of stone not to feel sorry for someone like Summer if they crashed to the floor in front of them, you’re pretty sure Claire will want to help. As you struggle to your knees, you see a uniformed arm reach down to help you back up. You grab it with a free hand and Claire hauls you back up to your feet.

“Thanks,” you say, starting to think about how much you want to take Claire’s shape and memories.

“You’re welcome,” she replies, trying to pull her hand back again. Your own hand goes with it.

Claire looks at her hand and yours in astonishment. You do the same. They look as if they have melded together and have an unhealthy bluish sheen to them.

Claire grabs you with her free hand, twisting your arm round, up and back as she forces you painfully to the floor face first. It’s a perfectly executed move that ends up with her pinning you to the floor by straddling your back.

“What the…” gasps Claire as she realises her mistake.

All that she has done is made contact with more of your body. You can’s see what’s happening (in fact all you can see is a close up of the floor tiles), but you know that everywhere she is touching you, flesh is melting together.

You feel it as her muscle control slackens and you are able to drag yourself to your knees. You catch a brief glimpse of what remains of Claire out of the corner of your eye and then she is gone, pulled inside your back with a glooping sound.

You pull yourself to your feet using the sinks as leverage. For a moment Summer’s face stares back at you from the mirror. Then your skin seems to crawl and stretch, you clothes fold on themselves and you are someone else.

You are Lieutenant Claire Briggs, United States Army and you are here on business. Colonel Lord, the commanding officer at Fort Suffolk has asked you, Claire, to contact your, her, friend Doctor Jillian Harding and ask for her help at Protean Industries. Sifting through your new memories, you now know that the Colonel suspects that Protean Industries intends to carry illicit research based on the SX series chemicals. The colonel, being a wily old fox, wants to secretly tap Jillian for information whilst having another officer, Captain Eric Sanchez, head up an ‘official’ investigation.

You dip into Claire’s memories, replaying parts of the conversation she had with Jillian moments before.

“How is the research going,” Claire had said.

“Great,” Jillian had replied. Claire had thought that Jillian had sounded nervous.

“SX-3?”

“I don’t think I can say.”

“Protean can’t research it without our permission,” Claire had explained. “Lord told me that’s what you’re working on.”

“Uh, yes,” Jillian had said, even more nervously. “Should we be talking about it here I mean.”

“We’ll be quiet,” Claire had continued, leaning in closer. “Look, what I’m about to say isn’t exactly official. We get reports from Protean about your work, but Lord doesn’t exactly trust Rosenstein.”

You snap out of your recollection for a second. Well, nobody trusts Levi Rosenstein, the director of research at Protean Industries. Sure, he sounds so smooth and confident, but every time you’ve ever talked to him, you’ve left with the feeling he would quite happily stab you in the back if it suited his purposes. You think back to the remainder of the conversation.

“Put it this way, do you remember the last project you worked on for us,” Claire had asked.

“I could hardly forget,” Jillian had responded.

“Lord thinks Rosenstein has filled in the gaps in the report we gave him. I told the Colonel you would have had nothing to do with that and he agreed, but Rosenstein has contacts elsewhere.” Claire had explained. She’d expected an angry response from Jillian but had been surprised when one hadn’t come. “Rosenstein knows about David Johnson and wants to repeat that ‘experiment’ in more controlled circumstances.”

At this point Jillian had spilled some of her coffee. Claire had assumed that Jillian was just shocked by the suggestion

“That’s monstrous,” Jillian had exclaimed. “Completely unethical. I would have nothing to do with anything like that.”

“I know,” Claire had said soothingly. “But Rosenstein, Lord knows Rosenstein from before somehow and he’s sure Rosenstein would. I know it’s a lot to ask but we need your help. We need someone to keep an eye on things for us.”

“Can’t you investigate yourself,” Jillian had interrupted.

“We can. We are. Eric is heading up the official investigation, but Rosenstein will have him chasing his own shadow. That’s why Lord wants someone on the inside to help.”

Claire had leaned back at that point. Both she and Jillian had sat quietly for a minute, giving Jillian time for the enormity of what she had been asked to do to sink in.

“Can you do it,” Claire had asked. “Can you help us?”

“I… I need time to think,” Jillian had stammered.

“Take your time,” Claire had replied, standing up. “But don’t take too long. Rosenstein is sure to start his experiments soon.”

And that was when Claire had gone to the rest rooms. What you’ve just learned has shaken you deeply. You want nothing more than to eject Claire out your body and pretend the whole thing never happened. You could hide out as Summer while the army investigates Protean Industries.

But sooner or later, the army is going to work out that you were exposed to SX-3. If you stayed as Claire, you could manipulate and redirect the investigation, ensuring that you or Jillian never come to any harm. It would be hellishly risky, however. You could even try to let the real Summer go free, she is an innocent in all this after all.

What if you could be both? Experimenting, you concentrate hard on Summer’s image and watch as your skin warps again. Within moments, the young student’s cheerful visage is staring back at you from the mirror. Another moment of concentration and you are Claire again. You could live a double life, at least for a while until you decide what you really want to do.

14.content:
A quick guide of the various characters appearing in the story. Characters will be added as they appear in the story.

Main Characters
Mark Taylor: The main character. A 28-year-old researcher for Protean Industries. An accident at his lab changes Mark's life forever...
Jillian Harding: Mark's research partner and girlfriend. 25-year-old former child prodigy who previously worked for the military. Creator of the compound SX-2 and its successor SX-3.

Fort Suffolk:
Lt. Claire Briggs: 26-years-old. Good friend of Jillian Harding. A consumate and professional soldier, she's very respected among the base personnel.

Protean
Thom Allan: A non-descript accountant for Protean living a boring, unfulfilling life. Married with two children.
Levi Rosenstein: The director of research for Protean. A rather unsettling individual.
Chip Henklemann: Former police officer who was "retired" after an injury. Is now Chief of Security for Protean.

Keyserling College:
Darcy Whitehead: 19-year-old freshman and graduate of Eastman High. Attends classes at the college while interning at Protean Industries, mainly as an assistant to Jillian Harding.
Summer Nguyen: 19-year-old arts major and former shrinking violet who has become friends with Darcy. Works part time at a small, nearby cofee shop.
Courtney Hamilton: Another Eastman graduate. Friend and co-worker of Summer's at the coffee shop.
Rhonda Turner: A sophomore at Keyserling; Summer's girlfriend. The two of them live together in an apartment off campus.

Other
David Johnson: Formerly a senior at Eastman. An accident at the military base Fort Suffolk turned him into a creature able to possess and control others. Seemingly disappeared soon afterwards.
Karin Allan: Thom's wife, a transplant from New York. Though her looks have faded she still remains shallow and self-absorbed.
Chels Snythe: Formerly Chelsea Cooper and formerly the head cheerleader at Westside High School. Moved to L.A. to become an actress and changed her name but has since returned to Saratoga Falls while on a shooting break.

info.brief_description: Thanks to an experiment, a young man gains the ability to alter his form... with a catch.
info.description:
Mark Taylor was a young man with a bright future. As a researcher at Protean Industries he had a great job at a company involed heavily with military contracts. However, while working on a new experimental compound called SX-3 an accident in the lab caused the small bit of experimental SX-3 to spill on Mark changing him. Mark Taylor's old life is now over but his new life is just beginning.

Mark's Powers
Thanks to being doused in the experimental compound SX-3, Mark has gained a very special ability: the ability to change himself into anyone he desires. However there's a catch: he must absorb those who he wishes to become. By absorbing them he absorbs both their genetic memory and mental memories allowing himself to turn into a perfect replica of the person right down to how they think... but a problem has also come with it. While he permanently remembers the form of anyone he absorbs, he can only copy their mental patterns while they're absorbed into him thus if he absorbed a person he could look like the person, know everything they know and act like them. He can eject the person from his body however and once that happens he could still become them physically but without the immediate access to their mind he could no longer become them mentally. Furthermore if he absorbs a person he has about three or four days to divest them otherwise he will "digest" them, killing them and making them a permanent part of himself.

General Rules
The same rules you've come to expect apply here. Spelling, grammar and the like must be minded. Sex is allowed however this is not a porn story. Chapters must be... involved, for lack of a better word. Nothing only a few sentences long or shallow... again for lack of a better word. I reserve the right to delete or edit chapters if I feel that they're not up to standards.

One last thing: this is an interactive story and thus a collaborative effort. You might have your own story to tell and that's cool but don't limit yourself to only adding to your own specific corner. Add to other storylines if you feel you have an idea for it. These stories are much more fun when authors play off of eachother. Don't worry so much about stepping on toes but be mindful of the story being told, what has happened in the chapter you're following up and where the story seems to be going. If you have a specific idea for a choice (or choices) at the end of your chapter, feel free to reserve it but don't get greedy and hoard.

Other than that, have fun and enjoy.
